pr_title: [core] Add support for rule chain execution for XPath 2.0

timeline.message:
[core] Add support for rule chain execution for XPath 2.0

Very similar approach to what has been implemented for Jaxen.
The existing rules still work as before.

Refs #1687
[core] Add more cases for Saxon rule chain

[core] Saxon XPath 2.0 and rule chain with visitors

This is an enhanced implementation of rule chain
support for XPath 2.0 expressions. It uses a own
visitor to analyze and modify the original
saxon xpath expressions.

timeline.bodyText: I think this undermines the benefits of using the rulechain? We'd effectively traverse once for each rulechain visit, and once for the whole tree, so we'd only be doing more traversals, while the whole tree visit suffices
timeline.author: oowekyala

replies.bodyText:
That should be the case - but I double check.
As far as I know: getRuleChainVisits() only returns the nodes, that should be visited and the rule chain calls the rule then only for these nodes. If it happens, that the rule called for whatever reason on a different node, that we would use the whole expression.
If we couldn't split up the expression, then the getRuleChainVisits() will return a empty list and for java the rule is called with ASTCompilationUnit - since we don't have a specific expression for this node, we would execute the whole expression (aka. fallback - AST_ROOT).
Actually, the current master impl returns the node name "_AST_ROOT" also in the "getRuleChainVisits()" list - luckily, we have no node named "_AST_ROOT", so no extra nodes are visited...
See 5fb6df7#diff-dd6490e8d37457789b60964710470e15R46 - I didn't fix that bevior for jaxen, because it should not matter.

When executing via rulechain, we get called here
https://github.com/pmd/pmd/blob/master/pmd-core/src/main/java/net/sourceforge/pmd/lang/rule/AbstractRuleChainVisitor.java#L87-L99
For each node separately.
This eventually ends up in the SaxonQuery, where we get the expressions for the node:
https://github.com/pmd/pmd/pull/2354/files#diff-ae9e480e9dfbc219210827dca4d4a6d8R132-R137
If there is no specific expression, we would return here the expression for AST_ROOT. But we only get called for the nodes, we explicitly returned via getRuleChainVisits()...
So, I don't see a problem here....

replies.bodyText: Ok, thanks for explaining. Then, I think we can merge this and see how it goes. I'll update the release notes when merging
